show.title: Gazer
show.headline: A mother with a rare brain condition and desperate for money takes a risky job

event.title: <show-title>Gazer</show-title> <event-type-title>w/Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline:
Director     Ryan J. Sloan, 
      Actor     Ariella Mastroianni Live in Person
event.description:
In-person Q&A with director Ryan J. Sloan and co-writer/actor Ariella Mastroianni

A young mother, contending with a rare brain condition and desperate to save money for her daughter’s future, takes a risky job from a mysterious woman with a dark past and gets entangled in a web of revenge, deceit, and murder. Shot on a shoestring budget but in magnificent 16mm, and co-written with the magnetic lead actress, Ariella Mastroianni, GAZER gazes back on the masters of the paranoid thriller of the '70s and '80s.

eventType.title: Live Q&A

eventType.description: Got a question for the director? Wanna meet the cast? At our special Live Q&A events, we follow the screening with an in-person discussion.

heroImage.altText: Event Category Web Hero Live QA 1920x1080

show.title: Secret Mall Apartment
show.headline: Rhode Island artists live in a secret apartment inside a mall for four years

event.title: <show-title>Secret Mall Apartment</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Director     Jeremy Workman Live in Person
event.description:
Live Q&A with director Jeremy Workman

In 2003, eight Rhode Island artists created a secret apartment inside the busy Providence Place Mall and lived there for four years, filming everything along the way. They snuck in furniture, tapped into the mall’s electricity, and even constructed a wall, smuggling in more than two tons of cinderblock.

Far more than just a wild prank, the secret apartment became a deeply meaningful place for its inhabitants. It was a personal expression of defiance against local gentrification, a boundary-pushing work of public/private art, a clubhouse in which large-scale charitable art projects were planned, and finally, a 750 square-foot "F you" to The Man.

Featuring never-before-seen footage of the space and revealing the identities of all the participants for the first time, SECRET MALL APARTMENT is more than just a bonkers true story. Director Jeremy Workman (LILY TOPPLES THE WORLD, THE WORLD BEFORE YOUR FEET, DECIDING VOTE) delivers a poignant exploration of a group of artists who discovered their purpose within the most commercial and improbable places.

eventType.title: Live Q&A

show.title: Across the Universe
show.headline: Julie Taymor's psychedelically fab musical celebrating love, life & The Beatles

event.title: <show-title>Across the Universe</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Julie Taymor's psychedelically fab musical celebrating love, life & The Beatles
event.description:
Jude (Jim Sturgess) is a dock worker from Liverpool who moves to America in hopes of a new beginning. When his path collides with college student Max (Joe Anderson, THE GREY) and Max's younger sister Lucy (Evan Rachel Wood, Westworld), the three souls journey along with an eclectic group of characters on a remarkable journey of transcendental, psychedelic American life that will either change them or change the world around them forever.

A mind-blowing, over-the-top blend of live-action and animation, director Julie Taymor (FRIDA) creates a musical that not only captures the essence of free speech and Vietnam wartime in 1960s America but also weaves a truly powerful love story conceived entirely from totally memorable Beatles songs, with every notable lyric pulsing in and out of the storyline.

We invite you to come along for this Magical Mystery ride, and to make this movie party extra special, we'll supply the props: protest buttons, rolling papers, a blue syringe pen, and rainbow glasses. The only question we ask you is, are you the Eggman or the Walrus?

show.title: Pride & Prejudice 20th Anniversary
show.headline: Sometimes the last person you want to be with is the one you cannot be without

event.title: <show-title>Pride & Prejudice 20th Anniversary</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Sometimes the last person you want to be with is the one you cannot be without
event.description:
One of the greatest love stories of all time, PRIDE & PREJUDICE, returns to the screen. When Elizabeth Bennet (Keira Knightley) meets the handsome Mr. Darcy (Matthew MacFadyen), she believes he is the last man on earth she could ever marry. But as their lives become intertwined in an unexpected adventure, she finds herself captivated by the very person she swore to loathe for all eternity. Based on the beloved masterpiece by Jane Austen, it is the classic tale of love and misunderstanding that sparkles with romance, wit, and emotional force.

Your ticket includes the following props:

  • Embroidered handkerchief
  • Lotion
  • Three postcards
  • Stationery
  • Potato keychain

show.title: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire
show.headline: Every revolution begins with a spark

posterImages.altText: Hunger games catching fire sp poster

event.title: <show-title>The Hunger Games: Catching Fire</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Every revolution begins with a spark
event.description:
After surviving the Hunger Games, you might think Katniss Everdeen (Jennifer Lawrence) and Peeta Mellark (Josh Hutcherson) would have earned a little rest and relaxation. Instead, they end up booked on a Victors' Tour, where they must pretend – for publicity purposes – to be irresistibly attracted to each other. In reality, Katniss is struggling with unresolved feelings about her neighbor Gale Hawthorne (Liam Hemsworth), a longtime friend and fellow hunter. Romantic trials and tribulations are about to take a back seat, however, to a new crisis.

All the glitz and glamour of the tour can't disguise the fact that Panem is falling into pandemonium. Revolts in several districts spark violence and a crackdown on dissent by the sinister President Snow (Donald Sutherland) and his associates.

But the worst is yet to come: Katniss and Peeta are summoned to the Capitol to compete in the brutal Quarter Quell, which pits them against other former Hunger Games champions in a battle involving a perilous jungle, toxic mists, mutant animals, and maddening "jabberjays" that inflict psychological torture on all who hear them. At the controls are the bloodthirsty Gamemakers, who have a personal interest in making sure that Katniss does not score a repeat victory.

Your ticket comes with the following props:

  • Finnick's sugar cubes
  • Quiver of matches
  • Suncatcher barrier tiles
  • Mini bow and arrow

show.title: Jaws (1975)
show.headline: Steven Spielberg's terrifying creature feature

event.title: <show-title>Jaws (1975)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: A bigger boatload of bite-y fun
event.description:
“This shark, swallow you whole.”

Duh, nuh…duh, nuh…nothing quite says "ah, summer" like watching an elusive giant shark terrorize Amity Island on the big screen. It’s the movie that perfected the summer blockbuster and launched a million toothy (and goofy) knock-offs, but none of them can compete with the bite of Spielberg’s 1975 original. This bona fide American classic has everything you could want from a movie: kids in peril, drunken sea shanties, and Richard Dreyfuss in a cage.

As if that wasn’t enough, this is a Movie Party, so you can live the shark-hunting adventure along with your pals Brody, Hooper, and Quint – minus the salty sea air and actual mortal peril. Featuring shark hats, yellow floatie drink holders (CAUTION: very susceptible to shark attacks), and a boat-shaped bath bomb with a great white shark in the center, it’s the most fourth-wall-busting fun you can have on dry land.

show.title: Vampire Hunter D (Subtitled)
show.headline: Hunting vampires in a post-apocalyptic world

event.title: <show-title>Vampire Hunter D (Subtitled)</show-title> <event-type-title>AXCN 40th Anniversary</event-type-title>
event.headline: Presented by Anime Expo Cinema Nights
event.description:
Presented in Japanese with English subtitles

Anime Expo Cinema Nights presents a special 40th-anniversary screening of the cult classic VAMPIRE HUNTER D. Audiences will be treated to a special introduction to the film by HIDIVE's Star Butler and Shudder's head of programming, Sam Zimmerman.

In the year 12,090 AD, technology and the supernatural have overtaken the world, leaving the land desolate and despotic. The remnants of humanity are scattered into small communities and live in fear of vampires who compose the ruling nobility. When Count Magnus Lee tastes the blood of Doris Lang, she is forcibly chosen to be his next wife. In an effort to escape her ill-gotten fate, she hires a mysterious vampire hunter known only as D, who comes from a peculiar lineage.

show.title: A Minecraft Movie
show.headline: A star-studded cast crafts up a crazy adventure in a new kind of block-buster

event.title: <show-title>A Minecraft Movie</show-title> <event-type-title>Family Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Get ready to craft your world at our interactive family party
event.description:
Welcome to the world of Minecraft, where creativity doesn’t just help you craft, it’s essential to one’s survival! Four misfits – Garrett “The Garbage Man” Garrison (Jason Momoa, AQUAMAN), Henry (Sebastian Eugene Hansen, JUST MERCY), Natalie (Emma Myers, Wednesday), and Dawn (Danielle Brooks, Peacemaker) – find themselves struggling with ordinary problems when they are suddenly pulled through a mysterious portal into the Overworld, a bizarre, cubic wonderland that thrives on imagination. To get back home, they’ll have to master this world (and protect it from evil things like Piglins and Zombies, too) while embarking on a magical quest with an unexpected, expert crafter, Steve (Jack Black, SCHOOL OF ROCK). Together, their adventure will challenge all five to be bold and to reconnect with the qualities that make each of them uniquely creative…the very skills they need to thrive back in the real world.

Your ticket comes with the following props:

  • Weapon keychain
  • Diamond gel cube
  • Face mask and crayons

show.title: Shrek
show.headline: The greatest fairy tale never told

event.title: <show-title>Shrek</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: The greatest fairy tale never told
event.description:
When a green ogre called Shrek discovers his swamp has been "swamped" with all sorts of fairytale creatures by the scheming Lord Farquaad, Shrek sets out, with a very loud donkey by his side, to persuade Farquaad to give his swamp back. Instead, a deal is made. Farquaad, who wants to become the king, sends Shrek to rescue Princess Fiona, who is waiting for her one true love. But once they head back with Fiona, it starts to become apparent that not only does Shrek like Fiona, but Fiona is keeping something secret.

Your ticket comes with the following props:

  • Ogre ears
  • Onion keychain
  • Eye-pop bird
  • Smell-along card

show.title: The Hunger Games
show.headline: May the odds be ever in your favor

event.title: <show-title>The Hunger Games</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: May the odds be ever in your favor at our interactive movie party
event.description:
Every year in the ruins of what was once North America, the evil Capitol of the nation of Panem forces each of its 12 districts to send a teenage boy and girl to compete in the Hunger Games. A twisted punishment for a past uprising and an ongoing government intimidation tactic, the Hunger Games are a nationally televised event in which "Tributes" must fight with one another until one survivor remains. Pitted against highly-trained Tributes who have prepared for these Games their entire lives, Katniss (Jennifer Lawrence) is forced to rely upon her sharp instincts, as well as the mentorship of drunken former victor Haymitch Abernathy (Woody Harrelson). If she's ever to return home to District 12, Katniss must make impossible choices in the arena that weighs survival against humanity and life against love.

Your ticket includes the following props:

  • Matchbook
  • Seneca Crane beard tattoo
  • Nightlock berry snacks
  • Mini bow and arrow

show.title: Noroi: The Curse
show.headline: Haunting analog horror from Japan.

show.title: Juliet of the Spirits
show.headline: Visions and memories help a woman find the strength to leave her husband

event.title: <show-title>Juliet of the Spirits</show-title>
event.headline: Fellini & Mesina spiritually tumble hand-in-hand through the looking glass
event.description:
"Your spirit must burn up like this incense, go up in smoke, on the altar of your loving body."

Change is inevitable. When viewed holistically, it is often for the best. “Stasis = death” or something platitudinous like that. But change can also be terribly painful and confusing, rending our conception of life asunder and questioning the foundations of our identity. Excuse me, perhaps I got lost in the sangria there momentarily.

In JULIET OF THE SPIRITS, Federico Fellini shifts his burgeoning psychedelic gaze from himself, established in his most famous film, 8 ½, to his wife and lead actress, Giulietta Masina. The titular Juliet is an upper-class woman who enjoys the privileges of her rarified lifestyle but feels isolated and disassociated from her cavalier philandering husband and posh friends. Following a revealing encounter with a spiritual medium, Juliet seeks guidance from her sensual and glamorous neighbor, Suzy, embarking on an uncanny journey of self-discovery. Filled to the brim with Jungian and LSD-inspired concepts and set pieces, JULIET OF THE SPIRITS is a bizarre and affecting effort from an artistic couple in transition. Was it cruel for Fellini to coerce his wife into playing out their martial issues on screen beneath the gauzy shroud of surrealist fiction? Absolutely! That said, the problematic process resulted in a fantastic film boiling over with queer subtext and gorgeous garments from Piero Gherardi. Come along with us as we delve deep into the world of dreams and disillusionment – and remember, your only fear is to be happy again.

DCP courtesy of Janus Films

show.headline: A woman wakes up and finds the crew of her space station viciously killed

show.title: Thank You Very Much
show.headline: Comedian Andy Kaufman blurs the lines between performance and reality

show.title: The Alto Knights
show.headline: The most dangerous enemy is an old friend

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

formats.title: 2D Digital
formats.headline: Digital format projected using a digital projector.
formats.description: Digital format projected using a digital projector.

formats.title: 35mm
formats.headline: Film print projected using film projectors.
formats.description: The industry standard for theatrical film releases prior to digital cinema. Film print projected using film projectors.

formats.title: Open Caption
formats.headline: Captioning will be displayed on the screen for the duration of the show.
formats.description: Captioning will be displayed on the screen for the duration of the show.

agePolicies.name: All Ages
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
